VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023C0000401
R400.4158 and R400.4112 were cited. Compliance is met with the completed
training of staff in Six Core Strategies and the termination of the staff who
performed inappropriate behavioral management of a youth. Compliance is
monitored for newly hired staff to complete Six Core Strategies training during new
hire orientation, quarterly Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) trainings for all
staff, and TCI discussion during team meetings.
2024C0000967
R400.4158, R400.4159, R400.4163 and R 400.4109 were cited. Compliance is
met with the written discipline for the identified staff performing inappropriate
behavioral management of a youth and their viewing and discussion of the video
footage of the incident with a supervisor. Compliance is met with the review of the
updated physical intervention policy and restraint reporting form. Compliance is
monitored for quarterly Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) training for all staff
and TCI discussion during team meetings.
Financial Overview
Whaley Children's Center 2022 financial audit was reviewed. Financial concerns
are not noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief administrator assessment was completed on 02/06/2024. Highlights from the
assessment include: 1. Mott Children's Residence is a Qualified Residential
Treatment Program. 2. Each youth has an Individualized Crisis Support Plan
(ICSP) that is developed by the youth and therapist. ICSP identifies the youth's
triggers and coping methods. It is kept on the unit and reviewed weekly by staff to

assist staff in understanding and working with the youth. ICSP’s are updated as
applicable. 3. Agency has a Zen Room and Creative Movement Room. A recent
grant was received to install acoustic panels and absorption materials to enhance
the calming environment.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Four staff were interviewed. Staff did not express concerns. Staff were able to
answer policy and procedure questions e.g. room monitoring procedure.
Three youths were interviewed. Youths reported feeling safe at Mott Children's
Residence and did not express concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The administrative and youth buildings were neat and orderly. The multipurpose
room was refurbished. The playground areas and basketball court are well
maintained. Staff were observed interacting or monitoring youths on the unit or at
the basketball court.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
